definition: peremptory/not to be denied/not brooking argument

sentences.english: Kong Yiji stared at the guy who asked him, with a look of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己看着问他的人，显出不屑置辩的神气。

sentences.english: The truth of this news story is beyond debate.
sentences.chinese: 这则新闻报道的真实性，无庸置辩。

definition: peremptory/not to be denied/not brooking argument
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
variegated/heterogeneous/to refute/to contradict/to ship by barge/a barge/a lighter (ship)
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
